docs.text: Quartile ¶ Grow your product sales with Quartile’s e-commerce advertising solutions across Amazon, Instacart, and other leading online marketplaces. Site Quartile About Documentation ¶ Welcome to the Quartile OpenAPI documentation. Currently, our APIs are documented through endpoints. Check API Connection ¶ Change the " {{sub_key}} " to your subscriber key. If you don't have a subscriber key, you can create it in the Developer Portal . $ curl "https://api.quartile.com/status?subscription-key={{sub_key}}" { "message": "running" }
docs.title: Home

Access the folder. $ cd QD_OPEN_API/documentation/ Create and activate a new virtualenv using poetry. $ poetry shell Spawning shell within /home/username/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/documentation-CgtZZHXK-py3.8 . /home/username/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/documentation-CgtZZHXK-py3.8/bin/activate Install requirements. $ poetry install Installing dependencies from lock file ... ... docs.text: [Linux and Windows] - Install SQL Server 17 Driver ¶ Linux https://docs.microsoft.com/pt-br/sql/connect/odbc/linux-mac/installing-the-microsoft-odbc-driver-for-sql-server?view=sql-server-ver15 Windows https://docs.microsoft.com/pt-br/sql/connect/odbc/download-odbc-driver-for-sql-server?view=sql-server-ver15 [Linux] - Check that it has been configured ¶ Linux cat /etc/odbcinst.ini Output: [ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server] Description=Microsoft ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server Driver=/opt/microsoft/msodbcsql17/lib64/libmsodbcsql-17.7.so.2.1 UsageCount=1 [Linux] - Install linux dependencies ¶ sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install unixodbc unixodbc-dev libgssapi-krb5-2 -y [Linux and Windows] - Install python dependencies ¶ Linux and Windows pip install pip --upgrade pip install pyodbc Test connection ¶ Create file python. nano db.py Add the code to the file. import pyodbc server = "tcp:<hostname>" user = "<username>" password = "<password>" database = "<database>" driver = "{ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server}" # default value authentication = "ActiveDirectoryPassword" # default value uri = ( f "DRIVER= { driver } ;" f "SERVER= { server } ;" f "PORT=1433;DATABASE= { database } ;" f "UID= { user } ;" f "PWD= { password } ;" f "Authentication= { authentication } " ) # this creates a string, don't change it. try : conn = pyodbc . connect ( conn_str ) print ( "Connect" ) except Exception as error : print ( "Error:" , error ) Save file and exit. ctrl + X Run the python file. python db.py
docs.title: [Linux and Windows] - Install SQL Server 17 Driver

docs.text: Linux https://docs.microsoft.com/pt-br/sql/connect/odbc/linux-mac/installing-the-microsoft-odbc-driver-for-sql-server?view=sql-server-ver15 Windows https://docs.microsoft.com/pt-br/sql/connect/odbc/download-odbc-driver-for-sql-server?view=sql-server-ver15
docs.title: [Linux and Windows] - Install SQL Server 17 Driver

docs.text: Linux cat /etc/odbcinst.ini Output: [ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server] Description=Microsoft ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server Driver=/opt/microsoft/msodbcsql17/lib64/libmsodbcsql-17.7.so.2.1 UsageCount=1
docs.title: [Linux] - Check that it has been configured

docs.text: sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install unixodbc unixodbc-dev libgssapi-krb5-2 -y
docs.title: [Linux] - Install linux dependencies

docs.text: Linux and Windows pip install pip --upgrade pip install pyodbc
docs.title: [Linux and Windows] - Install python dependencies

docs.text: Create file python. nano db.py Add the code to the file. import pyodbc server = "tcp:<hostname>" user = "<username>" password = "<password>" database = "<database>" driver = "{ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server}" # default value authentication = "ActiveDirectoryPassword" # default value uri = ( f "DRIVER= { driver } ;" f "SERVER= { server } ;" f "PORT=1433;DATABASE= { database } ;" f "UID= { user } ;" f "PWD= { password } ;" f "Authentication= { authentication } " ) # this creates a string, don't change it. try : conn = pyodbc . connect ( conn_str ) print ( "Connect" ) except Exception as error : print ( "Error:" , error ) Save file and exit. ctrl + X Run the python file. python db.py
docs.title: Test connection

docs.text: OAuth2 JWT authorization is a secure way to transfer your personal data and validate your identity. By default you need to create a set of tokens. In this set of tokens, you will receive an authorization token and a refresh token. Authorization Token: Use this token to make API request! Send this token in the request header. Token expires in 3600 sec (1 hour) after being created. Refresh Token: Use this token to request a new set of tokens. Token expires in 14 days after being created. Step 1. Access Profile ¶ After login, to to the "profile" page. You will see a "Generate Token" button, click this button. You will be redirected to new page where you can generate token. Generate Token ¶ Fill in Quartile email and password, click on "sign in". ¶ If you have logged in correctly, a set of tokens will be generated. ¶ { "authorization" : { "token" : "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6I..." , "type" : "Bearer" , "expires_in" : 3600 , "not_before" : 1627058225 , "note" : "Use this token to make the request in the API..." }, "refresh" : { "token" : "eyJraWQiOiJjcGltY29yZV8wOTI1MjAxNSIsInZlciI6Ij..." , "expires_in" : 1209600 , "note" : "Use refresh_token to request a new set of tokens..." } } Step 2. Endpoints authorization , refresh and validate ¶ Although the "Authorization" url is available, you don't need to use it because you will use the dev portal to generate a new set of tokens. With the generated tokens you can make API calls and request new tokens through the refresh endpoint. Method Type URL Description GET Authorization /auth/v1/token?code={code} The authorize token, normally the user with a customer profile does not have access to this data. If this is the case, you can obtain new tokens in the Tokens - Developer Portal > Profile . POST Refresh /auth/v1/refresh-token You need to enter the update token. If you do not have this data, "log in" again on the portal and request a new set of tokens (authorization token and refresh token) POST Validade /auth/v1/validate-token You can verify that the authorization token is valid.
docs.title: Create Authorization

docs.text: After login, to to the "profile" page. You will see a "Generate Token" button, click this button. You will be redirected to new page where you can generate token.
docs.title: Step 1. Access Profile
Fill in Quartile email and password, click on "sign in".

docs.text: { "authorization" : { "token" : "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6I..." , "type" : "Bearer" , "expires_in" : 3600 , "not_before" : 1627058225 , "note" : "Use this token to make the request in the API..." }, "refresh" : { "token" : "eyJraWQiOiJjcGltY29yZV8wOTI1MjAxNSIsInZlciI6Ij..." , "expires_in" : 1209600 , "note" : "Use refresh_token to request a new set of tokens..." } }
docs.title: If you have logged in correctly, a set of tokens will be generated.

docs.text: Although the "Authorization" url is available, you don't need to use it because you will use the dev portal to generate a new set of tokens. With the generated tokens you can make API calls and request new tokens through the refresh endpoint. Method Type URL Description GET Authorization /auth/v1/token?code={code} The authorize token, normally the user with a customer profile does not have access to this data. If this is the case, you can obtain new tokens in the Tokens - Developer Portal > Profile . POST Refresh /auth/v1/refresh-token You need to enter the update token. If you do not have this data, "log in" again on the portal and request a new set of tokens (authorization token and refresh token) POST Validade /auth/v1/validate-token You can verify that the authorization token is valid.
docs.title: Step 2. Endpoints authorization, refresh and validate

docs.text: Step 1 - Access The Developer Portal ¶ * Click here to access portal: Click on " Sign In ". ¶ Login using your Quartile account. ¶ Sign in using your email and password registered in the Quartile. ¶ Complete the form and click " Sign Up ". ¶ PS: Fill in the email field, with the same email you used in the previous step. Step 2 - Verify subscriber ¶ After registration, it is necessary to validate your subscription. Check your email, you will receive the confirmation.
docs.title: Start - Fist Access

docs.text: * Click here to access portal:
docs.title: Step 1 - Access The Developer Portal
Sign in using your email and password registered in the Quartile.

docs.text: PS: Fill in the email field, with the same email you used in the previous step.
docs.title: Complete the form and click "Sign Up".

docs.text: After registration, it is necessary to validate your subscription. Check your email, you will receive the confirmation.
docs.title: Step 2 - Verify subscriber

docs.text: Subscriber and Authorization ¶ Access Control (Subscriber) and Authorization (OAuth2), by default, all the requests to our API require a subscriber key and authorization token. Both the subscriber key and authorization token can be generate in the developer portal . Subscriber Key ¶ The subscriber is used to: Access control on the API Control requests, Reports, Limits and access products. P.S.: A subscriber key is 32-character alphanumeric text that contains a value that uniquely identifies a subscriber in our API. Authorization (OAuth2) ¶ The authorization token is used to validate your identity in Quartile LLC, this token is required to access our API. P.S: An authorization code is an alphanumeric password that authorizes your user to search, change, delete, or enter information into a security-protected API.
docs.title: About

docs.text: Access Control (Subscriber) and Authorization (OAuth2), by default, all the requests to our API require a subscriber key and authorization token. Both the subscriber key and authorization token can be generate in the developer portal .
docs.title: Subscriber and Authorization

docs.text: The subscriber is used to: Access control on the API Control requests, Reports, Limits and access products. P.S.: A subscriber key is 32-character alphanumeric text that contains a value that uniquely identifies a subscriber in our API.
docs.title: Subscriber Key

docs.text: The authorization token is used to validate your identity in Quartile LLC, this token is required to access our API. P.S: An authorization code is an alphanumeric password that authorizes your user to search, change, delete, or enter information into a security-protected API.
docs.title: Authorization (OAuth2)

docs.text: The user can subscribe to any product, but cannot have more than one active key for each product. All keys must be approved (activated by Quartile), activation deadline is 24 hours after creation. After logging in using your AD B2C account on the portal. Step 1. Subscribe To A Product ¶ Go to Products by clicking on the menu. ¶ All products will be listed, you can click on a product, for example: Advertising API. ¶ Fill in the key name and click Subscribe . ¶ Step 2. Check Your Keys ¶ Go to Profile . Check if your key has been created. All keys started with State Submitted, only after Quartile approval you can use.
docs.title: Create Subscriber
Go to Products by clicking on the menu.
All products will be listed, you can click on a product, for example: Advertising API.
Fill in the key name and click Subscribe.

docs.text: Go to Profile . Check if your key has been created. All keys started with State Submitted, only after Quartile approval you can use.
docs.title: Step 2. Check Your Keys

docs.text: Postman is an API platform for building and using APIs. Postman simplifies each step of the API lifecycle and streamlines collaboration so you can create better APIs—faster. Use Postman with an alternative to test and copy the endpoint call. Export the openapi.json file from the Developer Portal. ¶ Import into Postman. ¶ Postman tutorial - Click here P.S.: References
docs.title: Postman
Export the openapi.json file from the Developer Portal.

docs.text: Postman tutorial - Click here P.S.: References
docs.title: Import into Postman.

docs.text: The OpenAPI Specification (OAS) defines a standard, language-agnostic interface to RESTful APIs which allows both humans and computers to discover and understand the capabilities of the service without access to source code, documentation, or through network traffic inspection. When properly defined, a consumer can understand and interact with the remote service with a minimal amount of implementation logic. An OpenAPI definition can then be used by documentation generation tools to display the API, code generation tools to generate servers and clients in various programming languages, testing tools, and many other use cases. P.S.: References
docs.title: Specification

docs.text: You can copy the code of the call to the language of your choice. Select language ¶ Copy code ¶
docs.title: Generate code for lang

docs.text: Quartile Dev Portal has a simple option for you to make requests in our API and export code examples in Java, C#, Python, PHP etc. Log into the dev portal and access the API page. Access API ¶ Select an API ¶ Select an Endpoint ¶ See requirements for request ¶ All request parameters have a predescription of what that field is. What will return? ¶ Before making a request you can see what the endpoint should return. Scroll down to the response part, you can see what the status and return type of this endpoint is. Successfull response ¶ Unauthorized ¶ Unprocessable Entity ¶ Try it ¶ Make the request by clicking on Try it Click on the button Try it ¶ Select authorization_code ¶ If it is the first access, a window will open for you to login to generate an access token, after login the dev portal will automatically set an access token in your requests. Generate token automatically ¶ After generate token ¶ Select subscription key ¶ The subscription key is automatically set if you have a Quartile-enabled key for your access. Set the profileId ¶ Send request ¶ See the response. ¶
docs.title: Call the API through the portal

docs.text: All request parameters have a predescription of what that field is.
docs.title: See requirements for request

docs.text: Before making a request you can see what the endpoint should return. Scroll down to the response part, you can see what the status and return type of this endpoint is.
docs.title: What will return?

docs.text: Make the request by clicking on Try it
docs.title: Try it
Click on the button Try it

docs.text: If it is the first access, a window will open for you to login to generate an access token, after login the dev portal will automatically set an access token in your requests.
docs.title: Select authorization_code

docs.text: The subscription key is automatically set if you have a Quartile-enabled key for your access.
docs.title: Select subscription key
